name: Writing for Computer Science
author: Justin Zobel
description: I learned about the process of research, from reading to write-up, the advisor-student relationship, managing research like an agile (as opposed to waterfall) project to produce results, and much more.

name: The Ph.D. Grind: A Ph.D. Student Memoir
author: Philip J. Guo
description: I got a better idea of what challenges to expect as a PhD student and as a professional working in academia.

name: The Information: A History, A Theory, A Flood
author: James Gleick
description: Science and history are two of my favorite topics. This book includes both. It is about the history of science. I learned about the evolution of ideas and inventions such as the telegraph and the Difference Machine, etc.

name: Communicating Sequential Processes
author: Tony Hoare
description: Hoare defines a beautiful concise mathematical language for describing complex concurrent processes.

name: Art & Fear: Observations On the Perils (and Rewards) of Artmaking
author: David Bayles, Ted Orland

name: These Truths: A History of the United States
author: Jill Lepore
description: Beautiful prose, beautiful history.

name: The Book of Why: The New Science of Cause and Effect
author: Judea Pearl

name: The Five Dysfunctions of a Team: A Leadership Fable
author: Patrick Lencioni

name: The Craft of Research
author: Wayne C. Booth
description: I learned about the importance of writing and how important it is to start writing on day one.

name: The Wisdom of Teams: Creating the High-Performance Organization
author: Douglas Smith and Jon Katzenbach
description: This book taught me that in companies teams are a better performance measure than individuals. And that a team is more than a few people who sit next to each other and work on the same project.

name: The Concept of Law
author: H. L. A. Hart
description: I enjoyed the prose and the challenge of formulating a unifying concept and the analysis of the previous attempts was entertaining to read.

name: Fooled by Randomness
author: Nassim Taleb
description: A lot of behavioral economics experiments and stories. On a side note, I believe everything outside your control and knowledge appears random to you.

name: The Blind Watchmaker
author: Richard Dawkins
description: One of the first books that made me interested in evolution and biologically inspired algorithms.

name: Building Microservices
author: Sam Newman
description: I read this with a good friend of mine. We would read for 30 minutes and discuss what we had just learned over lunch.

name: The Software Craftsman: Professionalism, Pragmatism, Pride
author: Sandro Mancuso
description: Professionalism for software engineers.

name: The English Language: A Very Short Introduction
author: Simon Horobin
description: Where did English come from? And how has it evolved into the language used today?

name: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: One of the funniest books I have read.

name: Isaac Newton
author: James Gleick
description: The evolution of his ideas, the history of scientific publication and the Royal Society.

name: The Healthy Programmer: Get Fit, Feel Better, and Keep Coding
author: Joe Kutner

name: The Grasshopper: Games, Life and Utopia
author: Bernard Suits
description: Philosophizing about games.

name: The Problems of Philosophy
author: Bertrand Russell
description: Russell is one of my favorite thinkers.

name: Scarcity: Why Having Too Little Means So Much
author: Eldar Shafir and Sendhil Mullainathan
description: Subjective scarcity influences decision making.

name: Explore It! Reduce Risk and Increase Confidence with Exploratory Testing
author: Elisabeth Hendrickson

name: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Harari

name: Finding Flow: The Psychology Of Engagement With Everyday Life
author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi

name: Theory of Fun for Game Design
author: Raph Koster. Ratey

name: This is Marketing
author: Seth Godin
description: The crux of marketing explained.

name: Think: A Compelling Introduction to Philosophy
author: Simon Blackburn
description: Very readable introduction to important philosophical ideas explained in their historical context.

name: The Sense of Style: The Thinking Person's Guide to Writing in the 21st Century
author: Steven Pinker

name: The Structure of Scientific Revolutions
author: Thomas Kuhn
description: I love history of science. This book provides a cogent model for how scientific progress is made.

name: The Course of Love
author: Alain de Botton
description: A novel about love and marriage as it could happen in the real world

name: Adolphe
author: Benjamin Constant
description: French novel.

name: Conquest of Happiness
author: Bertrand Russell
description: I love the Russell's optimism and his reasoning.

name: Aura
author: Carlos Fuentes
description: Unique writing with second-person voice.

name: Range: Why Generalists Triumph in a Specialized World
author: David Epstein

name: Creativity, Inc.
author: Ed Catmull
description: Lessons learned about running Pixar its founder.

name: When Nietzsche Wept
author: Irvin Yalom
description: A novel about Nietzsche, Breuer, Freud and psychoanalysis.

name: The Remains of the Day
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
description: I felt like Mr. Stevens when I was organizing a hackathon, specially during the meals while I was making sure we had enough food and everyone was happy :)

name: How to Get Control of Your Time and Your Life
author: Alan Lakein

name: Spark! How excercise will improve the performance of your brain
author: Eric Hagerman, John J. Ratey

name: Pomodoro Technique Illustrated: The Easy Way to Do More in Less Time
author: Staffan Noteberg

name: The 12 Week Year
author: Brian P. Moran and Michael Lennington

name: Make it stick
author: Mark A. McDaniel and Peter C Brown
